Link: High isothermality value indicates taht diurnal termperature fluctuations are proportionally larger compared to overall annual temperature range, provides a measure of temperature stability within the course of a month relative to the years extreme

Measures the variability of precipitation over the course of the year using the coefficient of variation (CV) of the mean monthly precipitation totals, with a larger percentage indicating greater variability

Description: Multi-resolution valley bottom flatness: Identifies areas of deposited material at a range of scales based on the observations that valley bottoms are low and flat relative to their surroundings and that large valley bottoms are flatter than smaller ones
Ruggedness or Roughness of the Landform
Elevation (height above sea level) of the terrain at each location
How water would accumulate across the landscape based on the terrain
Difference in elevation within a local area; measures how flat or steep the terrain is.
Elevation relative to surrounding ridges; identifies local high points in the landscape.
Measure of terrain variability; quantifies small-scale elevation changes and unevenness.
Indicates potential soil moisture accumulation based on slope and upstream contributing area.
Depth of a cell relative to surrounding ridges; highlights depressions and valleys.
Numeric identifier for the most detailed ecosystem category (fine-scale macrogroup).
Broad ecosystem class; high-level grouping of terrestrial ecosystems
Intermediate ecosystem subclass; groups related ecosystem types within a class.
Detailed ecosystem division; most specific categorization of terrestrial ecosystems.
